verses.text: 耶穌是真葡萄樹「我是真葡萄樹，我父是培植的人。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian context.

verses.text: 所有屬我而不結果子的枝子，他就剪去；所有結果子的，他就修剪乾淨，讓它結更多的果子。

words.note: V-O compound, meaning to produce spiritual fruit.
V-O compound, meaning to produce spiritual fruit.

verses.text: 現在你們因著我對你們所講的道，已經乾淨了。

words.note: Refers to the message or truth of God.

verses.text: 你們要住在我裡面，我也就住在你們裡面。枝子若不連在葡萄樹上，自己就不能結果子；你們若不住在我裡面，也是這樣。

words.note: V-O compound, meaning to produce spiritual fruit.

verses.text: 我是葡萄樹，你們是枝子。住在我裡面的，我也住在他裡面，他就結出很多果子；因為離開了我，你們就不能作甚麼。
人若不住在我裡面，就像枝子丟在外面枯乾了，人把它們拾起來，丟在火裡燒掉了。
你們若住在我裡面，我的話也留在你們裡面；無論你們想要甚麼，祈求，就給你們成就。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for 'prayer, supplication'.
Often used for achieving great things or fulfilling prophecy.

verses.text: 這樣，你們結出很多果子，我父就因此得榮耀，你們也就是我的門徒了。

words.note: In a biblical context, usually refers to God the Father.
A key theological term.

verses.text: 父怎樣愛我，我也怎樣愛你們；你們要住在我的愛裡。

words.note: In a biblical context, usually refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 如果你們遵守我的命令，就必定住在我的愛裡，正像我遵守了我父的命令，住在他的愛裡一樣。

words.note: Often refers to divine commands in religious texts.
In a biblical context, usually refers to God the Father.
Often refers to divine commands in religious texts.

verses.text: 「我把這些事告訴了你們，好讓我的喜樂存在你們心裡，並且使你們的喜樂滿溢。

words.note: Preposition marking a direct object before the verb.
Indicates completion or realization of an action.
More formal and profound than '快樂', often used in religious contexts.
More formal and profound than '快樂', often used in religious contexts.
Often used metaphorically in religious contexts, e.g., 'cup overflows'.

verses.text: 你們要彼此相愛，像我愛你們一樣，這就是我的命令。

words.note: Used for comparison, typically with '像' or '跟'.
Emphasizes the direct consequence or conclusion.
Can also function as a verb, 'to command'.

verses.text: 人為朋友捨命，人間的愛沒有比這個更大的了。

words.note: Specifically refers to sacrificing one's life.
Can refer to the mortal realm or within society.
Forms an adjectival phrase modifying an implied noun.
Indicates a new situation or completion.

verses.text: 你們若行我所吩咐你們的，就是我的朋友了。

words.note: A more formal or literary 'if' than '如果'.
Often implies following a moral principle or command.
Used to form a noun phrase meaning 'that which is V-ed'.
Often implies a superior giving orders, common in scripture.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'those things'.
Indicates a logical consequence or conclusion.
Indicates a new status or situation has been reached.

verses.text: 我不再稱你們為僕人，因為僕人不知道主人所作的事；我已經稱你們為朋友了，因為我從我父那裡聽見的一切，都已經告訴你們了。

words.note: Introduces a role, status, or identity.
A very common term in biblical literature for a servant or bondservant.
A very common term in biblical literature for a servant or bondservant.
In a religious context, often refers to God or Jesus.
Used to form a noun phrase meaning 'that which is V-ed'.
Nominalizes the preceding verb phrase, meaning 'what is done'.
Introduces a role, status, or identity.
Indicates a new status or situation has been reached.
In this context, refers to God the Father.
Resultative verb, indicating the successful perception of sound.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'that which'.
Indicates completion or realization of an action.

verses.text: 不是你們揀選了我，而是我揀選了你們，並且分派你們去結果子，就是結常存的果子，使你們奉我的名，無論向父求甚麼，他必定賜給你們。

words.note: Often refers to divine election in biblical context.
Often refers to divine election in biblical context.
Often used metaphorically for spiritual results.
Implies permanence and eternal value.

words.definition: in the name of, by order of
words.note: Common in formal or religious contexts.
In this context, specifically refers to God the Father.
Formal term, often for divine or royal giving.

verses.text: 我把這些事吩咐你們，是要你們彼此相愛。
世人恨主也恨門徒「如果世人恨你們，你們要知道他們在恨你們以先，已經恨我了。

words.definition: the world, people of the world
words.note: Refers to humanity apart from God, or worldly people.
Refers to Jesus Christ.

words.definition: the world, people of the world
words.note: Refers to humanity apart from God, or worldly people.

words.definition: at, in, indicating action in progress

verses.text: 你們若屬於這世界，世人必定愛屬自己的；但因為你們不屬於世界，而是我從世界中揀選了你們，所以世人就恨你們。

words.note: In biblical context, 'world' often refers to the fallen human system.

words.definition: the world, people of the world
words.note: Refers to humanity apart from God, or worldly people.
In biblical context, 'world' often refers to the fallen human system.
In biblical context, 'world' often refers to the fallen human system.
Often refers to divine election in biblical context.

words.definition: the world, people of the world
words.note: Refers to humanity apart from God, or worldly people.

verses.text: 你們要記住我對你們說過的話：『僕人不能大過主人。』他們若迫害我，也必定迫害你們；他們若遵守我的話，也必定遵守你們的話。

words.note: Often implies a slave or bondservant in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 但他們因著我的名，要向你們行這一切，因為他們不認識那差我來的。

words.note: Refers to Jesus' authority/identity.
Implies knowing personally or intimately.

verses.text: 如果我沒有來，也沒有對他們講過甚麼，他們就沒有罪；但現在他們的罪是無可推諉的了。

words.note: Refers to moral transgression against God.
A formal four-character idiom.

verses.text: 恨我的，也恨我的父。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 如果我沒有在他們中間作過別人沒有作過的事，他們就沒有罪；但現在我和我的父，他們都看見了，也都恨惡。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Stronger than just 恨 (hate).

verses.text: 這就應驗了他們律法上所寫的話：『他們無故地恨我。』

words.note: Often used for prophecy fulfillment.
Refers to the Mosaic Law or scriptures.
Suffix indicating 'on' or 'within' a category/document.
Used before a verb to form a noun phrase, often literary/biblical.

verses.text: 「我從父那裡要差來給你們的保惠師，就是從父那裡出來的真理的靈，他來到的時候，要為我作見證。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in this context.
A transliteration and meaning compound for Paraclete.
Refers to God the Father in this context.
Refers to the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: 你們也要作見證，因為從開始你們就是跟我在一起的。」
